headline: Cornish Game Hens with Garlic and Rosemary
description: This Cornish hen recipe uses garlic, lemon, and rosemary to flavor little game hens, roasted with a rich white wine sauce. Simple yet elegant!

video.description: In this video, Nicole shows you how to make cornish game hens with garlic and rosemary. If you're looking to keep it delicious and affordable for the holidays, your search ends here.
video.name: How to Make Cornish Game Hens with Garlic and Rosemary

name: Cornish Game Hens with Garlic and Rosemary

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Rub hens with 1 tablespoon olive oil; lightly season with salt and pepper. Stuff 1 lemon quarter and 1 rosemary sprig into each cavity. Place hens in a large, heavy roasting pan and arrange garlic cloves around them.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk wine, chicken broth, and remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil together in a small bowl.

Remove hens from the oven; reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Pour wine mixture over the hens and continue roasting, basting with pan juices every 10 minutes, until hens are golden brown and juices run clear, about 25 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Transfer hens to a platter, pouring any cavity juices into the roasting pan; discard lemons and rosemary. Tent hens with aluminum foil to keep warm.
Transfer pan juices and garlic cloves to a medium saucepan; boil until reduced to a sauce consistency, about 6 minutes.
Cut hens in half lengthwise and arrange two halves on each plate. Spoon sauce and roasted garlic on top. Garnish with remaining rosemary sprigs and serve.

review.reviewBody: I've made this twice. Both times were great successes. Very easy. A little corn in the sauce if you like it thicker. Bon Appetit!

I made this for my husband and I on Christmas Day. I substituted lime for the lemon and I put 1 tsp ground rosemary in the cavity instead of sprigs. I used white cooking wine as well. Delicious with baby red potatoes. We loved it. My new favorite recipe.
I had to add seasoning because the dish was a little bland. Other than that it was good. It was moist and nicely done.

I made this for Christmas dinner for my husband and I. It was amazing. I did substitute a 1/4 of a lime instead of a lemon in each cavity. I made two. Instead of rosemary sprigs I added 1 tsp of crushed rosemary in each cavity.Delicious tender and juicy
Excellent!!! Prepared from the recipe with minor exceptions: I used White Cooking Wine and homemade vegetable broth (lower sodium.

I mostly followed the directions. At the oven temp. drop and basting stage, I removed the lemons and squeezed them out on top of the hens, and put slices of apples in the cavities for the second half of cooking. Great recipe, I’ll be using this for future poultry cooking reference for sure!
This was a pre-Thanksgiving entree. 4 hens, 6 mouths and the platter was empty in 30 minutes! The garlic from the roasting was mashed to give a very earthy taste and aroma to the gravy!

Prepared just as recipe suggested with the exception of putting pat of butter under skin and added Kinders wood fire smoked garlic spice with the salt and pepper. I fixed 2 in my cast iron skillet. Next time will add mushrooms to the sauce at the end. Best recipe I’ve tried in years!

We've enjoyed this for years. A traditional Christmas Eve dinner at our house. Lots of Rosemary growing here so put sprig in cavity and lemon wedge. (thought I made this up, LOL). Everything the same except for no wine and used pan juices to make gravy for mashed potatoes. Also I get the smaller game hens and do not cut in half. Much more fun when everyone gets their own chick... Very delicious dinner, easy and very festive!

This was delicious. I actually quartered the recipe did everything the way you described. I just added 3 potatoes and 6 carrots with Italian seasoning and some Adobo on the vegetables. The gravy was perfect even with the vegetables so tasty. Thank you so much definitely making again

The sauce was delicious but there was a fairly thick layer of fat in the roasting pan/sauce which I would separate out the next time. Will also try adding Rosemary sprigs on the outside of hens as well as in cavity. The meat was SUPER moist and tender!
Great Christmas Eve dinner recipe for family

The sauce described using this recipe turns out pretty good, but the recipe itself contains a few massive flaws. First of all, the amount of sauce it tells you to make for 4 hens is grossly insufficient and there is no way you could possibly baste the hens with such a small amount of liquid. I made a double recipe for the sauce and still BARELY had enough for only 3 hens. 2nd the cook time is MUCH longer than stated here. For typical sized hens you will probably need an additional 15-25 minutes depending on the size.
Simple and easy. Just myself so had only one hen and adjusted everything accordingly. Great flavor. I made this in 2020 and am doing it again here in 2021.
This was so wonderful!! The sauce is so delicious that I double it. I decided to thicken it up one time that I made it to make a gravy but I prefer it without thickening.
Made two cornish hens and kept the amounts for the sauce the same as for four. It was delicious.
Very good. I wanted more sauce. Would double that next time.

Wow, best cornish game hen recipe I have ever! I added some butter and herbs under the skin and added some broth in the bottom of the pan. After 25 min, lowered temp and flipped them breast side down when adding the wine/broth and continued basting through remaining cooking time (which was perfect). Don't waste that precious lemon inside the cavity that has now been infused with broth, garlic, rosemary and butter. Serve with the hens and let your guests use as much or as little as they like. Use the roasted garlic on crusty bread. Just WOW!
Awesome recipe! It was so simple and so delicious! I will definitely make this again!
Recipe was awesome! Not a garlic fan so I left that out. Also used the foil idea....man I love this app

These were delicious and EASY! Came out nicely browned on the outside and moist on the inside. I served with Wild and Brown rice (Alllrecipes recipe) roasted asparagus with Balsamic glaze and a carrot souffle. Perfect holiday dinner.

I cooked four hens for the four of us—but we only ate two of them the first night. I plated a half hen for each person, which was plenty with the sides I made. I used pieces of preserved lemon in the hens, and the flavor came through even better than in a full size chicken. I didn’t have any rosemary sprigs, so I just left them out. I sliced up an onion and scattered the pieces in the foil-lined roasting pan, then placed the hens on top. I distributed a bunch of heirloom carrots around the hens with the garlic (I didn’t quite have 24 cloves). To make the sauce, I used about twice the wine and chicken broth and threw in some leftover duck drippings. I like sauce. I served the hens with the carrots and boiled Yukon gold potatoes that I finished by frying in duck fat. Oh, and I had some enoki mushrooms--gave them a quick fry and garnished with those. The leftover hens were great the next day.

This is delicious!! The reduction sauce that you make at the end makes the whole dish so don't skip this step. I used a dry reisling for the white wine and it worked out great. About a 1 inch rosemary sprig in each bird worked great for us. I highly recommend trying this recipe!
This is really delicious and we loved all the garlic. I paired it with “sweet green bean bundles” (Allrecipes) and the combo of garlic with sweet smoky bacon was out of this world!
Perfect! It was the most succulent Cornish hens I’ve ever made. Simple ingredients w/a delicious outcome.
I really liked the flavors. Make sure to use a meat thermometer as the time did not work for me. it took almost an hour and a half rather than the 50 min described in the recipe.
Perfect! I added a Tbsp of butter to finish the sauce. Absolutely delicious.
Simple recipe that turned out great. This is perfect for beginners. They turned out soft and moist. A good alternative to chicken.
Easy and delicious! Will make again.
This is an excellent dish! I added water to the pan as others suggested for the garlic and I doubled the ingredients for the sauce as also suggested. This is a 10star dish hands down.
Phenomenal!

This was the first time I cooked Cornish Game hens (my father used to cook them frequently. ) and I couldn’t be more pleased with how they turned out. The recipe was simple, tasty, and easy to follow. I used lemons, rosemary and thyme to stuff the cavity of my birds. I only cooked two birds, so I halved the ingredients.

Made 1 time ,but never posted
I am making again on 8/26/20 
Changes, fresh Rosemary from Garden 
I make my own rub and use for all types of meat, poultry,Seafood
I made this recipe exactly as written and thought it was flavorless. High expectations based on reviews, but the results were not good. Won’t make again.
Super simple, with only few and easy to find ingredients and tastes delicious!

This was a simple and Very yummy way to make Cornish hens. As others have pointed out, I did have to cook them a little longer than instructed. However that could have been due to the fact that my roasting pan was on the small side for four hens and they didn’t have much space between them.

With so few ingredients and little prep work, I was worried that it might come out a little bland. I followed the recipe as written anyway. We chose Pinot Grigio for the wine.

This was surprisingly delicious! The hens were cooked to perfection. We'll be making this again.
Followed the recipe exactly right up to the end ... I added arrowroot to the liquid to form a heavier gravy. OUTSTANDING!
Absolutely delicious! Quick and easy. Followed exactly. Turned out beautifully. My kids devoured it
It took 90 minutes, not 50. Surprisingly, not much flavor with all of the garlic. My adult kids did not prefer it over boneless, skinless chicken breast. A lot of work for little reward.
It was a really good recipe. I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could. The only issue was cook time. Mine took about an hour and a half or so. Really good otherwise.

I air chilled the hens before cooking them. Next, I chopped up a sweet potato and sprayed it with olive oil, and placed the dressed hens on top. I followed the rest of the recipe as written. The hens were delicious.
Very good! Will definitely make this many more times in the future. Everyone loved it.
I love Cornish game gens. This is my favorite recipe.
Very flavorful

The recipe is simple enough. I baked two hens and the timing was too short (25 mins @ 450/25 mins@350). My hens were a bit underdone and could have used another 10-15 minutes on 350. The garlic in the pan was very much underdone - crunchy textured. Instructions did not specify where to place the rack so I baked then hens in the middle rack. Perhaps a higher placement would have been better. Definitely needed to season the hen cavities and under the skin. I followed the recipe and there was little flavor. Add some tweaks (herbs, spices and seasonings) and this could be an excellent recipe.
Can this be prepped or prepared a day ahead?
I'm not a fan of rosemary so I skipped it. Otherwise this came out WONDERFUL!!
I made it low sodium and low fat. Instead of wine I used homemade chicken stock. I added salt free Mrs. Dash seasoning to add flavor. It was FANTASTIC! Will definitely make it again!!

Make side dishes that can stand or wait until hens are cooked. I have never had an issue with timing following a recipe (within 5 min)... these took 1.5 hours of cooking time to reach 74°/juices running clear.

Tasty to be sure but unfortunately my side dish, which could have taken an extra 5 minutes of sitting and reheating, was a disappointment after 25 minutes of sitting and reheating.

Nice recipe, but I don't think adding Rosemary as a garnish does anything to the plate as a non editable and is a waste of money on an herb that should be used elsewhere. Food critics have often stated that on the Food Network.

I did not follow the recipe exactly. I didn't use the vinegar. I made a butter and herb mixture that included adobo, minced garlic, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried basil and dried rosemary. I put that under the skin of the hens and on the outside of them. They came out great. Few other minor adjustments I made but all in all this recipe helped me make a great meal. Thanks!

This recipe makes a fantastic presentation if you're looking for an elegant meal! I do as others and double the gravy recipe. I like to serve it with red-skinned mashed potatoes, steamed broccoli, crusty rolls, and a green salad. One of our family faves!!
Used half a lemon inside each hen. Added sliced onions to four cloves garlic. 1 cup chicken broth instead of broth & wine.

I made it with two hens, but used the full amount of liquid per suggestion in another review. My husband loved it, although I will admit I didn't use any garlic, since he doesn't like it at all! (But I did put some chopped garlic in the sauce.) Easy to put together and was enough for two meals.
Easy recipe. Tasted great!
Use a meat thermometer! Took way less time than stated.
So delicious!
Delicious and Juicy

I've never had cornish when before. It seemed a little tougher than ordinary chicken which surprised me. I thought the smaller bird would be more tender. Maybe I didn't cook it right, but I tried to follow the recipe as closely as possible. I also thought it would be more flavorful. I'll try again and update my review another time.
solid. easy. good
Absolutely amazing. I have served this dish when I am hosting guests it's always a hit! It's replacing the turkey for Thanksgiving this year.
I prepared this exactly as directed and it was delicious! So moist and tender! I will definitely make this again.
Awesome and quick. Was fun to prepare. I used Wild Turkey 101 instead of wine for the awesome sauce.
The sauce was delicious!!!! Great recipe!

This is a great recipe! Similar taste to Cornish Hen we at Dolly’s Dixie Stampede! 4 was too much for our 2 adults and 3 kids under7 yrs old. I didn’t use wine, just added more chicken stock to make the difference in liquid. I also added sliced purple onion in the cavity. Also used a tablespoon or 2 of corn starch to thicken the sauce. Next time I’m going to use limes instead of lemons for a stronger citrus note. Or I might just do it the same way again. Again, great recipe and easy to make!

DELIGHTFUL!!!! My bf loved it and the only reason I didn’t exactly follow the original recipe was due to specific taste preferences. Otherwise, fantastic recipe which I will make again and again. Thank you!!!!
Everyone Loved this! Used chicken broth with a little bit of red wine vinegar instead of the white wine and it was amazing I will be making this again! Thanks for this awesome recipe!
Made only 2 Hens, kept everything else exactly as written, Amazingly Delicious! Thanks for the recipe, definitely a keeper!

Made this last night and everyone LOVED it! I made it exactly as written -- no changes. It came out perfectly. When I said we were having "Cornish Game Hens" everyone was very impressed because it sounds hard but it's super easy. I will definitely make this again.
Moist, flavorful and delicious. Will make again
I made it as written this Easter and it was a great hit. I will make this again!!!!!
Didn’t use any oils or butter and added onions and removed skin after cooking

I have made this several times. If you are on the fence about this one, do not be. Try it- this is a very nice savory chicken dish that is not packed full of unnecessary ingredients. Everything added to this one is a meaningful ingredient.
my wife's favorite, easy to make
Very good easy to make
Very good. Easy to make
easy and wonderful tasting cornish hens family loved them
Good flavor, but needs to cook longer
The Cornish hens turned out great. Everyone loved them.

First time cooking cornish game hens, and they turned out great! I actually smoked them for about 40 minutes using hickory wood chips (temp around 250F), and then finished them off in the oven. Family and I loved them and will do again!
I love this recipe, however, I did cut the recipe in half. I do wish you would put serving sizes on your recipes.
I love this recipe, however, I did cut the recipe in half. I do wish you would put serving sizes on your recipes.
Sorry, I thought it was bland.

Roasted only one game hen for the two of us.
Used 1 lemon half and 1 rosemary sprig in the cavity.
Used 3 garlic cloves cut into strips.
Used 1/4 cup white wine and 1/4 cup broth to baste.
Otherwise, followed directions exactly.
I didn't have rosemary, so I used thyme. It was very moist and favorful. I will make it again.
I will definitely make it again, sorry I didn't take any pictures of it.

This recipe was really good and we really enjoyed it a lot. Delicious! I made this recipe as written with a few small changes. I added thin slices of lemon and garlic underneath the skin before roasting. To the rotating pan I added multicolored small potatoes, carrots, parsnips, and mushrooms.

I added a little bit more wine and chicken stock to the drippings to make a bit more gravy. It needed some corn starch to thicken properly.
My husband, who always has suggestions for improvement, loved this recipe. He wants me to make it again.
Yes will make again. Great flavor. A little hard to serve because I didn't have a knife sharp enough to cut in half!
We ended up eating later than I wanted because the game hens were not done. Definitely needed more cooking time. Hens were juicy though, not dried out.

12/27/18 This was delicious and so very easy. I added garlic cloves inside the hens and used oranges as I have an over abundance of oranges right now. I put the hens on a low rack so they would not sit in the bottom of the pan and get soggy. As one reviewer suggested, I poured about a cup of chicken broth in the bottom of the pan before baking. The garlic smelled strong but was mild in taste. I did double the sauce and it was needed, especially for leftovers. I will try it again with lemon as I'm sure that's delicious, too.

Cooked three hens. Used a red wine instead of the white because that is what I had on hand. 
The sauce is very tasty. Overall a success.
Yes I will make it again.

Made this for a festive family dinner and followed the recipe exactly. The roasting pan I used was too deep so the birds did not brown enough—easily fixed with a short turn under the broiler. I served it with a morel mushroom risotto, which balanced well with the bright flavors of the sauce. A very elegant meal that was pretty easy to prepare.
This was very good. I chopped up the garlic and rosemary added olive oil and spread over and under the hens skin. Did not use the lemon or wine this time around.
I made this with no salt and used salt free chicken broth and it was delicious!
Definitely would make again. My family enjoyed it, would make a great meal for a small dinner party.

It was excellent, the market was out of fresh rosemary so I put dried rosemary in the chicken broth and let it cook down before basting, served with Brussels sprouts and new potatoes with the same broth?? Very good, I will make again. Thankyou!
Im sorry to say I was disappointed with the seasoning. A little bland. The birds didn't crisp up like i wanted. If I make it again I'll kick up on the seasonings. Brinding too.

item.name: Cornish Game Hens with Garlic and Rosemary
